REVIEW_TITLE: Good steak, but not great and disappointed in management
REVIEW_DETAILS: I stopped in here for a 5pm dinner and had a good & underwhelming experience. I hadn't eaten at Gallaghers for maybe 15 years and was pleased to try it again. I ordered the French Onion soup which was fantastic.. excellent, rich broth, filled with onions, nice large crouton and tons of cheese. A very nice soup. I also ordered a prime rib, thinking this would be a restaurant to give Smith & Wollensky a run for the money. Not even close. The cut that came out was an "English Cut" at best, maybe 3/4" thick, perfectly medium rare until I cut it to discover.. it was cold. Not warm like medium rare, but cold like it had been sitting on a plate for 20 minutes since my soup had come out. I asked the waiter about it and the maitre'd was there at the same time who told me "well, you ordered it medium rare".. I was so shocked I asked "are you saying I don't know the difference between COLD and medium rare?" He said he'd be right back and he returned with my same prime rib placed under a salamander for maybe 30 seconds. I was so stunned, I just ate the steak which was a prime cut, but thin, no great dry aged flavor and nothing to write home about. The waiter apologized and otherwise, service was great. But, I was just disappointed in the response, the treatment of what should have been a flagship cut of prime rib and questioning a patron. I might go back, but if the steaks are like this, I think I'll stick with their cross town rivals.Read more

ADDRESS: 228 W 52nd St, New York City, NY 10019-5802
REVIEW_DETAILS:
Gallaghers is really good at what they do.  Five of us went recently and had a great time.  All good NY steakhouses serve high quality beef so the difference comes down to things like service, atmosphere, and how they do everything else on the menu.  Gallaghers keeps their menu short on purpose.  They want the things they do serve to be special.  The raw bar and appetizers are special.  Try the clams casino, salmon tartare, crab meat cocktail and, for a real treat, the shrimp and lobster dumplings. If you don't want beef, the veal chop is an excellent choice. Sides are all good but make sure to try their mac n cheese - its worth it.
Gallagers has a very classic and inviting feel.  They put a lot of people in a relatively small space but it doesn't have that crowded feel. As for service, If you're going to a NYC steakhouse part of the experience is the brusque waiters.  As long as they're attentive and helpful with the menu, its all good. Gallaghers waitstaff is no different, but they're not rude like some places I've been. Hint, don't go in the 5-6 pm timeframe - they will push you along.  Go after 7pm and you'll feel less rushed.Read more

We had heard a lot about Gallagher's - it was somewhere that had been highly recommended to us by a number of family members and friends. It was our first evening of our birthday trip to NYC (first time ever in the US!) and Gallagher's was the first restaurant of the trip. We'd heard amazing things so were very much looking forward to it.

Whilst we waited for our table, we had a drink at the bar. The bar and interior design of the restaurant is lovely and very elegant. The bar staff were a joy also.

We were shown to our table, which was a bit of a squeeze, in the back corner of the restaurant. We were given some bread and offered water which was great. As we were both quite tired and we only ordered mains and sides: the New York sirloin and the fillet mignon with fries and mushrooms. We were sat at our table for 18:30 and ordered around 18:40. However, at 19:30 our waiter came over to apologise and said he had 'lost our order' and therefore it hasn't gone through to the kitchen, We were of course quite gutted, but accepted the apologies as these things can happen anywhere and reordered again. 19:50 was when we were thinking we might have to get up and leave as by this point, we'd been sat for almost an hour and half and felt as though we were being ignored. at 20:00 both our steaks and the sides came to the table - however, there was no apology for the delay from the waiter.

The food was delicious. Honestly absolutely faultless. Both steaks were deliciously juicy and cooked to perfection. The only problem was, as we had waited so long I wasn't as hungry anymore and had started feeling sick so I couldn't manage my fries.

As we were quite disappointed by the service we had received, we thought we might have had some compensation with regards to the bill. Nope. We were charged $160 + tips. When I only gave $10 on top of the $160 the waiter challenged my partner and he ended up giving another $10. I was quite disappointed by this as we had heard such incredible things and whilst the food was indeed amazing, we felt quite let down by the service from our waiter.

Everyone else we met that evening was absolutely lovely and a delight. The food was spectacular. We would still re-visit despite the incident however, I think it is right that Gallagher's are aware of this feedback reasons.Read more

It is quite obvious when you read the reviews that the service you get depends on who you are.

I visited in October and had a reservation for 1 at 8:30 pm. I came at 8:30 and was told to wait around the bar for my table. The bar was full at this time and it would be hard to order without disturbing the guests sitting there,  no waiter came and asked if I wanted a drink. I waited for my table (booked at 8:30) for one hour, and at 9:30 I was asked if I would like to sit at the bar or a table. Being alone, bar would have been fine if they asked earlier, but I said it was what ever at this point as I was already boiling inside. I was then seated at a table.

The waiters at the table have the old-school service you expect from a place like this, and the waiters themself are rather old. Nothing wrong with that itself at all though. I ordered a cocktail for my app (caesar sallad) and I asked for a glass of red with the steak (NYC sirloin). The app came before the drink. I didnt get the red wine for the steak - I was not billed for it nor did I ask again so maybe I didnt say it clearly enough.

Caesar was okay, nothing special and of course not worth 16 bucks. But hey, its NYC prices.

The NYC Sirloin was super good, but was hard to enjoy at this point as the treatment kind ruined my night. Pricewise it's what you are going to get at this price in NYC.

I payed the bill in full, with 18 or 20% tip and I also tipped the warderobe lady. The service at the table was good.

What ruined my experience completely is that I waited over an hour to be seated when I already had a booking. I have worked many years in the res biz and understand that this happens, how hard is it to try to make up for it? Im not saying giving away free stuff, but atleast you can send a waiter to where im sitting (not the bar but in the bar area) to take a drink order. The staff at the front (not the servers) but what I presume was the maitre d was also quite judgmental and extremeley unprofessional. 

I would just take my money else-where, at this price point there are countless places that will have way better service, and way better food. Obviously nothing changes, as all the reviews complain about the bad front of house.Read more

REVIEW_TITLE: Still a great steak place, but watch what you order.
REVIEW_DETAILS:
I think Gallagher's is still a pretty great steak place, though the prices are a bit out of hand. I almost gave it just 3 stars because of the price of drinks and wine, but since I did have a food credit and many other places similar to this are also just as expensive, I gave it 4.
 This was probably my 3rd or 4th visit over several decades.

I ate on a weekday and there were lots of open spots right at the bar. I had an Old Fashioned, which was $17. I felt the steak prices were just too high, so ordered the less-expensive $38 Double Pork Chop, with a side of $12 green beans and the $21 Escargot appetizer. I looked through their wine list and was shocked at the very high prices, many for what are common grocery store wines, like Meiomi going for $17/ glass!
I had 2 glasses of a nice $22 Merlot, but looking back I probably should have called and seen if they offered corkage and brought my own bottle.

My meal seemed to take a long time to come out. Just as I was inquiring, it appeared and I saw WHY it look so long. The Loin Pork Chop was about 3 inches thick! They gave me a great steak knife to help cut into it and it was very good. I could only finish half of it, so got the rest to go.

My whole meal, with tax and tip came to over $167. Not sure I'd do that if I didn't have a food credit. I'd probably go back, but try one of the entrees, which come with a side, like the salmon or the chicken. And maybe have a drink for free while playing at the slots before dinner!Read more

A few minutes before the time of our reservation they offered to sit us. We were led to the main dining room and were seated in a spacious booth. As it was 3 of us i was fearing they would sit us on a small table for two. I was wrong.
We ordered a few appetizers, they were all excellent... clams Casino, clams oreganata, canadian bacon...
Their wine list is extensive but a bit pricey.
For the entree we shared a Tomahawk and a Sirloin, they were both delicious and cooked the exact way we ordered. The creamed spinach was amazing, and so were the other sides we ordered... mashed potatoes and brussel sprouts.
Finally we closed the night with a warm slice of pecan pie, which is one of my favorites. It didn't disappoint.
So even though lately i tend to believe that most steakhouses in NYC are very similar in terms of quality and service Gallagher's is the exemption. It's amongst the top ones for sure. Can't wait to visit again.Read more
